name: Nitro
body:
## Overview Nitro is a programmer-directed code variant tuning framework, jointly developed by the [University of Utah](http://www.cs.utah.edu) and [NVIDIA Research](http://research.nvidia.com). Nitro provides a library interface that permits programmers to express code variants (alternative implementations of a computation) along with meta-information that aids the system in selecting among the set of variants at run time. Machine learning is employed to build a model through training on this meta-information, so that when a new input is presented, Nitro can consult the model to select the appropriate variant. **Release Update [Jul/2014]:** Code release is planned for Fall, 2014. Thank you for your patience. ## Publications Check out the following paper for an overview of Nitro's design, and some initial results showcasing Nitro's effectiveness. [**Nitro: A Framework for Adaptive Code Variant Tuning**](http://www.cs.utah.edu/~sauravm/docs/nitro_ipdps2014.pdf)
_S. Muralidharan, M. Shantharam, M. Hall, M. Garland, B. Catanzaro_; Proceedings of the 28th IEEE International Parallel & Distributed Processing Symposium, pp. 501-512, May 2014, Phoenix (Arizona) USA
